glsa.title: mod_gnutls: Certificate validation error
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in mod_gnutls allows remote attackers to spoof clients via crafted certificates.

background.p: mod_gnutls is an extension for ​Apache’s httpd. It uses the ​GnuTLS library to provide HTTPS. It supports some protocols and features that mod_ssl does not.

description.p: It was discovered that the authentication hook in mod_gnutls does not validate client’s certificates even when option “GnuTLSClientVerify” is set to “require”.

impact.p: A remote attacker could present a crafted certificate and spoof clients data.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
